JUDGES: Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mykhaylo Buromenskiy;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in the town of GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicant was the owner of several underground garages . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant and the private company ORG PERSON ( “ the company ” ) signed a joint venture contract ( “ the contract ” ) under which the company took on an obligation to construct CARDINAL office buildings above the garages ( “ the disputed property ” ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings against the company in ORG , alleging that it had failed to comply with the terms of the contract . The applicant requested that the court declare the contract void . He also sought a ruling requiring the company to destroy the unfinished buildings . Lastly , he claimed compensation for pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed the applicant 's claims in part . The judgment became final .

CARDINAL . On DATE , following an objection ( протест ) by the Prosecutor of GPE , the Presidium of ORG of GPE quashed the judgment of DATE and remitted the case to the first - instance court for fresh consideration .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found against the applicant . On DATE ORG adopted an additional judgment in the case . These judgments became final .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a new claim against the company seeking a ruling requiring the latter not to hinder him in use of the garages .

CARDINAL . On DATE the company instituted proceedings against the applicant seeking division of the disputed property and claiming ownership rights to CARDINAL of it . The company also claimed compensation for pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage .

CARDINAL . On DATE , following an objection ( protest ) by the Deputy Prosecutor of GPE , the Presidium of ORG of GPE quashed the judgment of ORG of DATE and the additional judgment of DATE and remitted the case to the first - instance court for fresh consideration .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG joined the proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's claims and allowed the company 's claims in part . On DATE ORG of GPE upheld that judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the decisions of the lower courts and remitted the case to the first - instance court for fresh consideration .

CARDINAL . By a judgment of DATE ORG found against the applicant . By the same judgment the court partly allowed the company 's claims . The court , inter alia , recognized the company 's right to use a CARDINAL of the disputed property .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE remitted the case to the first - instance court since the latter failed to examine all the claims lodged by the parties to the proceedings .

CARDINAL . By additional judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG examined the remainder of the claims . The court partly allowed the company 's claim for ownership and rejected the remainder of the applicant 's claim in respect of pecuniary damage .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE upheld the judgment of DATE . By the same ruling the court of appeal dismissed the company 's claim for ownership and upheld the remainder of the additional judgment of CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . The applicant appealed in cassation before ORG . On DATE ORG quashed the part of the judgment of DATE concerning the company 's right to use CARDINAL of the disputed property and upheld the remainder of the decisions of the lower courts .
